document.heading: Life Insurance Special Contingency Reserve Amendment Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-89, the “Life Insurance Special Contingency Reserve Amendment Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-162, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on December 4, 1997, and January 6, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 26, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-262 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-89 became effective on April 29, 1998.

Code § 1-623.13 is amended by adding a new subsection (e) to read as follows e) When a policy purchased pursuant to section 2205 is replaced by a successor policy, either by a new policy under a contract with the same life insurance company or by a policy under a new contract with another life insurance company, any balance remaining in the special contingency reserve shall be transferred to the special contingency reserve for the new policy Sec. 3.
